meanings.definition: The quality of being oriented or directed towards the front
meanings.sent1: The frontality of the building made it easy to find.
meanings.sent2: The soldier's frontality showed his readiness for battle.
meanings.sent3: The frontality of the cat staring at the mouse was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her frontality in the meeting room commanded attention.
meanings.sent5: The frontality of the mountain against the sunset was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: The state of facing forward or being positioned at the front
meanings.sent1: The frontality of the ship allowed for a clear view ahead.
meanings.sent2: The frontality of the classroom made it easy for the teacher to see all students.
meanings.sent3: The frontality of the car in the parking lot made it stand out.
meanings.sent4: His frontality in the race gave him an advantage over others.
meanings.sent5: The frontality of the stage made the performance engaging for the audience.

meanings.definition: The use of frontal perspective in art or design
meanings.sent1: The artist's frontality in the painting created a sense of depth.
meanings.sent2: The frontality of the sculpture highlighted its intricate details.
meanings.sent3: The frontality of the logo on the billboard caught everyone's eye.
meanings.sent4: Her frontality in graphic design brought a fresh approach to the project.
meanings.sent5: The frontality of the mural on the wall added a dynamic element to the room.
